org.jenkinsci.plugins.RepositoryPlugin

Class RepositoryPluginDefinition

  • java.lang.Object
    • hudson.model.ParameterDefinition
      • org.jenkinsci.plugins.RepositoryPlugin.RepositoryPluginDefinition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    hudson.ExtensionPoint, hudson.model.Describable<hudson.model.ParameterDefinition>, java.io.Serializable

    public class RepositoryPluginDefinition
extends hudson.model.ParameterDefinition
    Add components in Jenkins Job Configuration to add a repository for virtual machines generation.
    In Job Configuration page, check GitBucket > This build is parameterized > Repository Parameter.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • RepositoryPluginDefinition

        @DataBoundConstructor
public RepositoryPluginDefinition(java.lang.String repoAlias,
                                               java.lang.String url,
                                               int visibleItemCount)
        This constructor is called when saving new configurations in a job.
        Initializes the required repository for installing packages.
        Parameters:
        repoAlias - The name of the repository.
        url - The URL of the repository.
        visibleItemCount - The number of packages you will see in the "Build with parameters" page before you have to use the scrolling bar.
